title: File:Bear proof shutters impaled with nails on Savage Cabin in Denali National Park, Alaska.jpg
author: Bob Keefer from Gettysburg, USA
description: One of a pair of thick wooden shutters impaled with nails on Savage Cabin in Denali National Park, Alaska. The nails are meant to deter bears from trying to open the shutters and enter the cabin through its window, such as in order to access food inside.
